ratings.comment: the class is insanely disorganized, and really long.
The class is way too long and the class is very unorganized.
Very disorganized. Does not use trigger warnings when watching films about self harm. Waste of time. do not take this class unless you are required to.
Very disorganized. Easy class. Not worth taking unless you are required to.
Sue is a good professor, but her instruction and delivery is not as great.

Dr. Sue is an incredibly kind individual. While she can be a little disorganized, you can tell she loves what she does. I was surprised at how much I learned last semester. You will need to set aside a lot of outside class time for your Community Based Learning project so I'd recommend having a reliable source of transportation.
Dr. Sue is so funny and caring. Class can be long but she really does care about students learning about disability.

Disorganized. Would show up late. Made attendance mandatory however claimed we were lying about attendance through QR code so made us wait in lines to sign our names on paper (class 100 students)- made me late to my next class every week. Lecture consisted of her copying and pasting our discussion boards on slides to talk about it. Easy A though.

Dr Sue is a compassionate and caring person, although she fails to transfer her passion into the classes. She appeared very disorganized and was frequently discombobulated with directions and expectations for assignments. She's a great person, but isn't a clear professor

I learned so much from this class and found it so valuable. As long as you do your work, you will get an A. Dr. Sue is kind, knowledgeable, and easy to communicate with. There were two textbooks priced around $15 each, so very affordable and good reads that were easy to digest while still learning valuable information. I 100% recommend this class!
